intro: Sanicula chinensis var. paupera, commonly known as the Chinese sanicle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive fern-like appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
